001//import javax.swing.*;
002import javax.swing.JFrame;
003import javax.swing.JTextField;
004import javax.swing.JTextArea;
005import javax.swing.JLabel;
006import javax.swing.ImageIcon;
007import javax.swing.JPanel;
008import javax.swing.JScrollPane;
009import javax.swing.JButton;
010import java.awt.Image;
011import java.awt.Graphics;
012import java.awt.Frame;
013import java.awt.Graphics2D;
014import java.awt.GradientPaint;
015
016//import java.awt.*;
017import java.awt.Dimension;
018import java.awt.BorderLayout;
019import java.awt.Color;
020import java.awt.Font;
021import java.awt.Toolkit;
022//import java.awt.event.*;
023import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
024import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
025import java.awt.event.WindowAdapter;
026import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;
027import java.net.URL;
028/**
029 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
030 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
031 * 
032 * This class implements a simple graphical user interface with a text entry
033 * area, a text output area, an image and a button.
034 * 
035 * @author Michael Kolling + Elie DUBOUX
036 * @version 1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2019) edited (2021)
037 */
038public class UserInterface implements ActionListener
039{
040    /**
041     * The game engine.
042     */
043    private GameEngine aEngine;
044    /**
045     * The frame.
046     */
047    private JFrame     aMyFrame;
048    /**
049     * The entry field.
050     */
051    private JTextField aEntryField;
052    /**
053     * The text field.
054     */
055    private JTextArea  aLog;
056    /**
057     * The image for the room.
058     */
059    private JLabel     aImage;
060    /**
061     * The button look.
062     */
063    private JButton    aButtonIntentory;
064    
065    /**
066     * The image for the background.
067     */
068    private JLabel aImageBackground;
069    /**
070     * Construct a UserInterface. As a parameter, a Game Engine
071     * (an object processing and executing the game commands) is
072     * needed.
073     * 
074     * @param pGameEngine The GameEngine object implementing the game logic.
075     */
076    public UserInterface(final GameEngine pGameEngine)
077    {
078        this.aEngine = pGameEngine;
079        this.createGUI();
080    } // UserInterface()
081
082    /**
083     * Print out some text into the text area.
084     * @param pText The text to print.
085     */
086    public void print(final String pText)
087    {
088        this.aLog.append(pText);
089        this.aLog.setCaretPosition(this.aLog.getDocument().getLength());
090    } // print()
091
092    /**
093     * Print out some text into the text area, followed by a line break.
094     * @param pText The text to print.
095     */
096    public void println(final String pText)
097    {
098        this.print(pText + "\n");
099    } // println()
100
101    /**
102     * Show an image file in the interface.
103     * @param pImageName The path and the name of the image.
104     */
105    public void showImage(final String pImageName)
106    {
107        String vImagePath = "" + pImageName; // to change the directory
108        URL vImageURL = this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource(vImagePath);
109        if (vImageURL == null)
110            System.out.println("Image not found : " + vImagePath);
111        else 
112        {
113            ImageIcon vIcon = new ImageIcon(vImageURL);
114            this.aImage.setIcon(vIcon);
115            this.aMyFrame.pack();
116        }
117    } // showImage()
118
119    /**
120     * Enable or disable input in the input field.
121     * @param pOnOff True when you can write on the entry field,
122     * false otherwise.
123     */
124    public void enable(final boolean pOnOff)
125    {
126        this.aEntryField.setEditable(pOnOff); // enable/disable
127        this.aButtonIntentory.setEnabled(pOnOff);
128        if (! pOnOff) 
129        { // disable
130            // cursor won't blink
131            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate(0);
132            // won't react to entry
133            this.aEntryField.removeActionListener(this);
134            this.aButtonIntentory.removeActionListener(this); 
135        }
136    } // enable()
137
138    /**
139     * Set up graphical user interface.
140     */
141    private void createGUI()
142    {
143        this.aMyFrame = new JFrame("RPandaScape");
144        this.aEntryField = new JTextField(34);
145        this.aLog = new JTextArea();
146        // {  
147             // public void paintComponent(Graphics g) 
148             // {  
149                  // Graphics2D comp2D = (Graphics2D)g;
150                  // comp2D.setColor(Color.blue);
151                  
152                  // GradientPaint pat = new GradientPaint(0f, 0f, Color.white,100f,45f,Color.blue);
153                  // comp2D.setPaint(pat);
154             // }  
155        // };
156        this.aLog.setFont(new Font("SansSerif", Font.BOLD, 12));
157        this.aLog.setEditable(false);
158        this.aButtonIntentory = new JButton("inventory");
159        
160        //this.aLog.setOpaque(false);
161        //(0,206,209) blue 
162        this.aEntryField.setBackground(new Color(255,239,213));
163        this.aLog.setBackground(new Color(255,239,213));
164        JScrollPane vListScroller = new JScrollPane(this.aLog);
165        vListScroller.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(200, 200));
166        vListScroller.setMinimumSize(new Dimension(100,100));
167
168        JPanel vPanel = new JPanel();
169        this.aImage = new JLabel();
170        vPanel.setLayout(new BorderLayout()); // ==> only five places
171        vPanel.add(this.aImage, BorderLayout.NORTH);
172        vPanel.add(vListScroller, BorderLayout.CENTER);
173        vPanel.add(this.aEntryField, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
174        vPanel.add(this.aButtonIntentory , BorderLayout.EAST);
175        
176        // JPanel contentPane = new JPanel() 
177        // {  
178             // public void paintComponent(Graphics g) 
179             // {  
180                  // Image img = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("images/background.jpg");  
181                  // g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, this.getWidth(), this.getHeight(), this);  
182             // }  
183        // };
184        
185        // contentPane.setLayout(new BorderLayout());
186        // //contentPane.setOpaque(false);
187        // vPanel.add(contentPane);
188        // this.aMyFrame.setContentPane(contentPane);
189        
190        this.aMyFrame.getContentPane().add(vPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
191        
192        // add some event listeners to some components
193        this.aEntryField.addActionListener(this);
194        this.aButtonIntentory.addActionListener(this);
195        
196        // to end program when window is closed
197        this.aMyFrame.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() 
198        {
199            public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) { System.exit(0); }
200        });
201        
202        
203        this.aMyFrame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(600, 800));
204        this.aMyFrame.pack();
205        this.aMyFrame.setVisible(true);
206        this.aEntryField.requestFocus();
207    } // createGUI()
208
209    /**
210     * Actionlistener interface for entry textfield.
211     * @param pEvent The event when a button is clicked.
212     */
213    public void actionPerformed(final ActionEvent pEvent) 
214    {
215        if (pEvent.getSource() == this.aButtonIntentory)
216            this.aEngine.interpretCommand("inventory");
217            
218        if (pEvent.getSource() == this.aEntryField)
219            this.processCommand();
220    } // actionPerformed(.)
221
222    /**
223     * A command has been entered. Read the command and do whatever is 
224     * necessary to process it.
225     */
226    private void processCommand()
227    {
228        String vInput = this.aEntryField.getText();
229        this.aEntryField.setText("");
230
231        this.aEngine.interpretCommand(vInput);
232    } // processCommand()
233} // UserInterface
